thread.title: Three local non-profit recognized at Innovation and Excellence Awards
thread.title_full: Three local non-profit recognized at Innovation and Excellence Awards

author: 13abc
title: Three local non-profit recognized at Innovation and Excellence Awards
text:
TOLEDO (13abc Action News) - Three area non-profit were recognized for their hard work in the community at the fifth annual Innovation and Excellence Awards Tuesday morning.
The awards are presented by The Blade and The Toledo Community Foundation.
Imagination Station was given the" Innovation Award", for their partnership with the Lucas County Children Service and making sure parents have a safe environment to interact with their children.
Black Swamp Conservatory received the "Small Agency Excellence Award" for their work in preserving natural habitats and agriculture land in northwest Ohio.
The "Large Organization Excellence Award" went to Family and Child Abuse Prevention Center for their dedication in making sure abused children have a safe home.
Each of the winners received a $5,000 grant from Toledo Community Foundation, a $1,00 grant from the Anderson,; free full page ad in The Blade, and a public service announcement from Buckeye CableSystem.
